metadata.idinfo:
Indiana State Department of Health (ISDH) (Data source) Indiana Geological Survey (Data processor) Denver Harper (Data processor) Chris Dintaman (Data processor) 20070516 HOSPITALS_CLINICS_ISDH_IN: Hospitals and Rural Health Clinics in Indiana in 2007 (Indiana State Department of Health, Point Shapefile) 1 Vector digital data
Bloomington, Indiana Indiana Geological Survey
Phone numbers, addresses, and information regarding type of facility were obtained from Web pages of the Indiana State Department of Health (http://www.indiana.gov/isdh/regsvcs/acc/hospital/wdirhos.htm; http://www.in.gov/isdh/regsvcs/acc/rhcdir/wdirrhc.htm). Personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey used ESRI ArcMap 9.2 to build an "Address Locator" and used the "Geocoding" tool to perform address matching, using street information licensed from Tele Atlas, Dynamap/2000, v. 17.0.
http://igs.indiana.edu/arcims/statewide/download.html
HOSPITALS_CLINICS_ISDH_IN is a point shapefile showing the locations of 160 hospitals included in a "Hospital Directory" that appears on a Web page of the Indiana State Department of Health (ISDH) (http://www.indiana.gov/isdh/regsvcs/acc/hospital/wdirhos.htm), as well as the locations of 55 rural health clinics included in a "Rural Health Care Clinic Directory" that appears on the ISDH Web site (http://www.in.gov/isdh/regsvcs/acc/rhcdir/wdirrhc.htm). Using street addresses from the directory, a shapefile was created using the "Geocoding" tool in ESRI ArcMap 9.2 and street information licensed from Tele Atlas, Dynamap 2000 v. 17.0. On May 11, 2009, at the request of a user, the location of

ESRI ArcGIS version 9.2 shapefile format, approximately 302 Kb St Margaret Mercy Healthcare Center South, Dyer, Indiana, was more accurately located. UNIQUEFILENAMEUNIQUEFILENAMENone

attracc.attraccr: Street addresses and telephone numbers for hospitals and rural health clinics were obtained from the Web site of the Indiana State Department of Health and are assumed to be accurate. Geocoding produced match scores of more than 80 percent for 90 percent of hospitals on the "Hospital Directory" obtained from a Web site of the Indiana State Department of Health and for 74 percent of rural health clinics. Locations of other hospitals and rural health clinics with scores less than 80 percent were plotted by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey using the "Editor" tool in ESRI ArcMap version 9.2, together with information obtained from Google searches, MapQuest (http://www.mapquest.com/maps/), and inspection of aerial photographs of the 2005 Indiana Orthophotography Project.

dataqual.logic: No checks for logical consistency were made.
dataqual.complete: All hospitals listed by the Indiana State Department of Health have been included. Fifty-five (55) of fifty-seven(57) rural health clinics are included; two clinics (St. Vincent North Clinic and St. Vincent South Clinic, located near Williamsport and Veedersburg, respectively) could not be located using either Tele Atlas, Dynamap 2000, or Mapquest, and these were deleted from the list of rural health clinics.

horizpa.horizpar: For match scores greater than 80 percent, plotted locations are generally within several hundred feet of actual locations.

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this shapefile.

srcinfo.srccontr: Addresses and phone numbers of hospitals
Addresses and phone numbers of rural health clinics.

citeinfo.title: Dynamap 2000
citeinfo.othercit: Indiana roads from Tele Atlas, Dynamap/2000, v. 17.0, licensed to the Indiana Geological Survey

srcinfo.srccitea: Indiana roads from Tele Atlas, Dynamap/2000, v. 17.0
srcinfo.srccontr: Indiana streets and roads suitable for geocoding

procstep.procdesc: Telephone numbers and addresses for each hospital and rural health clinic were compiled by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) from directories available on the Web site of the Indiana State Department of Health. The hospital address list was saved as a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet named "HOSPITAL_LOCATIONS.XLS." The clinic address list was saved as a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet named "CLINIC_LOCATIONS.XLS."
procstep.srcused: ISDH Hospital Directory (http://www.indiana.gov/isdh/regsvcs/acc/hospital/wdirhos.htm); ISDH Rural Health Clinic Facility Directory (http://www.in.gov/isdh/regsvcs/acc/rhcdir/wdirrhc.htm)

procstep.procdesc: IGS personnel used street information licensed from Tele Atlas in ESRI ArcMap 9.2 to build an "Address Locator." Using the "Geocoding" tool to perform address matching, HOSPITAL_LOCATIONS.XLS and CLINIC_LOCATIONS.XLS were address- matched. A total of 144 hospitals were matched to known addresses. Sixteen (16) hospital locations needed to be manually plotted using the "Editor" tool in ESRI ArcMap, together with locations obtained using Google searches, MapQuest, and inspection of aerial photographs of the 2005 Indiana Orthophotography Project. The output was saved as HOSPITALS_ISDH_IN.SHP. The following fields were then deleted from the attribute table: "Side," "ARC_Street," "ARC_Zone," "Zip," and "State." A total of 48 clinics were matched to known addresses. Seven (7) clinic locations needed to be manually plotted using the "Editor" tool in ESRI ArcMap, together with locations obtained using Google searches, MapQuest, and inspection of aerial photographs of the 2005 Indiana Orthophotography Project. Two (2) clincs were deleted because they could not be located using Google searches and Mapquest. The output was saved as CLINICS_ISDH_IN.SHP. The following fields were then deleted from the attribute table: "Side," "ARC_Street," "ARC_Zone," "Zip," and "State." Using ESRI ArcToolbox, HOSPITALS_ISDH_IN.SHP and CLINICS_ISDH_IN.SHP were merged to create HOSPITALS_CLINICS_ISDH_IN.SHP

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

edom.edomvd: Originally "unmatched" address in batch geocoding. Subsequently plotted by personnel of the IGS.

attr.attrdef: In geocoding, a value assigned to all potential candidates for an address match. The match score is based on how well the location found in the reference data matches with the address data being searched. The top score (best match) is 100.
Name of hospital or rural health clinic
Street address of hospital or rural health clinic
City and Zip-code area in which hospital or rural health clinic is located
Phone number of hospital or rural health clinic
Type of facility. Types include CHURCH HOSPITAL, LOCAL HOSPITAL, OTHER HOSPITAL, PRIVATE HOSPITAL, PROPRIETARY HOSPITAL, STATE HOSPITAL, and RURAL HEALTH CLINIC.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It is not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone other than the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
